Posts.Content: Hi Sunriser52 As far as I know they are the same thing.  Sue xx
Posts.Title: Histology or Pathology ?

Posts.Content: Charlie95 Hi Charlie How can we help? Sue diag 22/2/2008
Hi Anne Congratulations on your divorce from Desmond. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: Hi Katie So sorry to hear this. A friend I knew on this site had BC in 2010 and was diagnosed with lung and brain secondaries 2 years ago. She is still doing well  I hope the MRI scan went well today and you get a treatment plan sorted. It is a lesson for us all. If you are worried about anything insist on a scan.We all know our bodies and know when all is not well. Love Sue xx  .
Posts.Title: Five radiotherapy treatments left....developed brain mets....

Posts.Content: @kaz18 Hello Kaz I was diagnosed with lobular breast cancer in 2008. I also had a mastectomy and removal of lymph nodes, 6 rounds of TAC chemo followed by radiotherapy. I had a breast reconstruction in 2010.  Just completed  10 years of taking Arimidex. Discharged from the breast clinic in August this year.   You will make it and you will be a stronger woman. Just take one step at a time,. You will get lots of support from the ladies on this site.  All the very best Sue xx
Posts.Title: Hormone positive lobular breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi  dminnimouse Just wishing you all the best for tomorrow.   Sue Diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Just hours away from getting my biopsy results so scared

Posts.Content: Hi What Happened I had the breast MRI too not long ago. Was an experience!!!!   I had Radio 2 on the headphones and the first music played was That's the Way I like it.  Had to smile. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Spine MRI tomorrow can't eat, sleep, concentrate.

Posts.Content: Hi Raychw I had my surgery on a day case basis. My BP was a bit low after the op so I stayed overnight. Came out the next morning and was fine. A day of hospital food was enough for me. All the best Sue Diag 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Mastectomy op help

Posts.Content: Hi Gillian I had similar to you. On a CT scan on my chest for problems with breast implant the scan came back showing a small abnormality on my right lung. Like you I had had 3 lots of antibiotics but my cough was no better. Had a bronchoscopy which takes samples of the fluid and that came back as nothing sinister. Had another CT scan 4 months later and it came back clear. You will be given a CT scan I am sure and perhaps what I had too.  It is so hard not to think the cancer has returned but try not to panic.  One of my friends on the site had lung cancer and was not well enough for chemo. He is still goung strong 10 years later. I have 4 small grandchildren and I hope I can see them grow up All the very best. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Possible lung cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Zam Zam When I farted it was like the smell of a chemical factory.  Horrid. Just used to say sorry about that. lol Sue x
Posts.Title: Chemo farts

Posts.Content: Hi Snowy's Mum All the best for tomorrow. Big girl pants on and keep calm. It will soon be over. Fingers crossed for good news. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Spine MRI tomorrow can't eat, sleep, concentrate.

Posts.Content: Hi Newbie I loved my V shaped pillow for use when having chemo and spending some time in bed Agree with the coffee shop vouchers  Did get tea and coffee on chemo unit and chocolates from previous greatful  patients. Would have loved a nice cream cake  Would have loved a posh thermometer too. The one I was given was a bit of hit or miss. Sue  diag 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Supporting my SIL

Posts.Content: I used to ring my GP and he would look up the results on the computer. Sad that he has now retired. Think BC Nurses should be ex patients as they would know how it feels. It is my pet hate.  Am still waiting for results of a CT scan I had on 10th August. I assume it is clear on the basis that if it is bad news I would have been contacted by now.  Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: Annual mammogram - how long for result

Posts.Content: Good Luck Let us know what you decide. I had a great plastic surgeon in Birmingham who had been recommended by a Breast Reconstruction Group. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Advice please! Cannot decide between LD flap and implant or expanders...

Posts.Content: Hi Chris I was diagnosed in 2008 and went through surgery chemo and rads. Have had a mammogram every year since. I am now 67. Would rather have the mammogram as a safety net. Not sure I could face chemo again. Love Sue
Posts.Title: Mammograms are they needed every year

Posts.Content: Hi Coco 74 I had an LD reconstruction with implant in 2010. I also had an implant in my good breast so they matched. Yes it was a very long operation. I think mine was 9 hours but of course I didn't know at the time. I had the op on a Thursday and came out on the Sunday. No drains. The results were very good and looked natural. In April this year I had the implant removed and replaced due to capsular contracture . This can happen at any time and I had eight years before it happened. All implants may need to be replaced at some time.  I haven't had any problem with weakness in my back as I am not a sporty type but can lift my grandchildren up which is what matters to me. Perhaps your surgeon can introduce you to some ladies who have had this procedure done.  All the very best with your decision. No pain no gain. Love Sue Diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Advice please! Cannot decide between LD flap and implant or expanders...

Posts.Content: Hi I know what you mean about the sticky feeling. Keep doing the exercises and the feeling will go eventually. Wash the area with Simple soap and rub a little Aqueous Cream or E45 cream on to the sore bits. Good luck  Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Sticky armpit!

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine. Wonderful news.  Hope you are celebrating xxxxxx Sue xx
Posts.Title: The results are in!

Posts.Content: Hi there. I have a friend who has recently had surgery to transfer fat  from her tummyto fill the dent plus a lift to her "good breast." She had her initial surgery 4 years ago. This was done as a follow up procedure. Ring the BCN. I am 10 years since diagnosis but I still ring them if I have any problems. They always respond so no problem if you have been signed off from the clinic. All the best Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy 5 half year ago

Posts.Content: Hi Winney My diagnosis was 22nd Feb 2008. Glad you are more relaxed now. Have a very Happy Christmas and a healthy New Year Love Sue xxx.
Posts.Title: Back and shoulder pain

Posts.Content: Hi Winney I have been on Arimidex for 9 years and over this time I have had 3 bone scans because of pains in my ribs shoulders and back. I have a bad back at the moment which may be the result of picking up my grandchildren and my age of 68. Try not to worry over Xmas.  I don't think we will ever relax but anastrozole is the reason for many of my problems. Would like to stop taking them but am scared in case I jinx myself. Only 11 months to go now  Can't wait to stop and hopefully feel more like myself at long last. Wishing you all the best. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Back and shoulder pain

Posts.Content: Hello It's great that you come back on the site and share your story. I am 10 years since diagnosis and the surgery chemo and rads is a distant memory now. I have been lucky that since my diagnosis I have seen the births of 4 lovely grandchildren. I come on here occasionally to give hope to newly diagnosed ladies. The treatment is rough but doable. Let us hope that a cure is found very soon. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Third year mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi Pookie All the best for tomorrow. I had my results in Feb 2008 and had mastectomy chemo and radio. Lymph node involvement too. Made my will just after and started my bucket list. Still here. Its 9 years tomorrow since I was given the news. Still got to have a kebab as it is on my list. Will be thinking of you. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Awaiting breast biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi Treacle321 First of all well done for getting to the end of your radiotherapy. Hope and pray your kidneys are ok and you don't have to face cancer again. I always said I didn't think I could go through chemo again. Life is sweet tho and if I had to go through it again I would have too. I have had a few scares since I finished treatment and have had CT and bone scans during the last 10 years. Fingers crossed all will be well. Good Luck Sue Diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: one step forwards....

Posts.Content: Hi James I think LeoLady is having some time off tonight  but wanted you to have a reply. My hospital did a CT and Bone Scan before my mastectomy as a matter of routine. I had already had a biopsy on my nodes and several had cancer cells so I had clearance of the nodes too. It is good that she is being scanned quickly as the worse thing is the waiting. Fingers crossed that the CT and bone scan are clear and she can start on her treatment plan. My diagnosis was in 2008 and I am still going strong. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Has anyone had a CT scan before diagnosis?

Posts.Content: James UK  Hi again. Positive news about the scans. I never had a peep out of any radiologist after my scans. Had an agonising wait after every one. So pleased your lady is stong and healthy which will go a long way to dealing with any treatment she is going to have. The waiting is the pits. I know it seems an eternity until April. How to cope? You will get by with help from your friends and family. Take a notebook or record the conversation you have with the Consultant as it is easy to forget what is said. She is lucky to have you to support her. All the very best and let us know how she gets on. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Has anyone had a CT scan before diagnosis?

Posts.Content: Congratulations. Hope you have a lovely day on Sunday. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Good News Story for a cold Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi Wilson 81 Deep breaths. Hope all goes well for you on Wednesday. Good to have your husband with you for support. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Got my referral - Wednesday morning

Posts.Content: Hi Goeash Waiting for treatment and results is so stressful. Do you know which scans you are having?  I was having a CT scan recently and telephoned the CT Dept and asked if I was on the list and when it was likely to be done  I always say that if they have a cancellation to contact me as I live about 3 miles from the hospital and can get there quickly. Hope you don't have to wait too long. I have learnt during the last 9 years since my diagnosis that you have to be proactive to make sure your name is on the list. Love Sue  xx
Posts.Title: Appointments!

Posts.Content: Hi Chrissi. I had today a questionnaire from the Royal College of Surgeons aimed at women who have had mastectomies. i volunteered to complete these when I was first diagnosed. I completed one last year and have just completed this one ready to post. One of the questions was If you could choose again would you opt for reconstruction at the same time as the mastectomy. Could answer Yes No or Not Sure. I wrote I was told I could not have one as I would have to have radiotherapy. I still am not happy that I was told I could not have it done. My surgeon in Worcester did not seem 100% behind reconstructions so that is why I am having mine done in Birmingham.    They do not realise it would give you such a boost to your confidence if they would do the reconstruction.  I hope you get a satisfactory answer. These questionnaires were created because so few women had reconstructions after mastectomy. They are looking for answers as to why this should be. I hope they follow up on my answer. All the best Sue x x x
Posts.Title: Secondary Breast Cancer and Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Crissi I know how you feel to want to look normal again. I had a mastectomy in April 08 followed by chemo and RT. My treatment finished in Nov 08. Was told I could not have a reconstruction for 12 months after RT. I have seen Mr Guy Sterne at the City Hospital in Birmingham twice in the last few months and I got a letter this week saying that I was on the list for early in the New Year. Although City Hospital is not my local hospital I have been recommended to him and have seen some reconstructions he has done and the results were amazing. I think you have to ask the question. Can I have a reconstruction even tho I have been diagnosed with secondary BC, i know you want this more than anything. Would make up somewhat for all the treatment you have been through. I wish you the best of luck and hope everything works out for you. Lots of Love Sue x x x x
Posts.Title: Secondary Breast Cancer and Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Cathclmb  My breast cancer diagnosis was in 2008 and I had a mastectomy, chemo and rads followed by a delayed reconstruction in 2010. I have just completed 10 years of taking Arimidex I  have had annual mammograms and an examination by the BC Consultant. If I had any concerns or pain I was given a bone scan or CT scan. A recent problem with my reconsructed breast resulted in me having a CT scan followed by a breast MRI. As a matter of course scans are not offered on an annual basis but assured any concerns you have will be taken seriously. All the best. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Surprised! Advised no follow up scans moving forward - Anyone else...

Posts.Content: Hi Jen Yes I am still awake. Good that you have an appointment so soon. You will probably have an ultrasound Mammogram and possibly a biopsy. Try not to worry. Not easy I know. I am 9 years post diagnosis and enjoying life. Good luck for next week.  Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: Lump in my armpit.

Posts.Content: Hi Tessa Don't think you are a stalker just worried as we all are about recurrence. I saw my oncologist on Monday and she said the danger period was 2 years from diagnosis. I have just reached my two years so felt a bit better. She said to be aware of bumps and lumps and feeling generally unwell.    Best of luck with the rest of your treatment. Sue xxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: lumps and more lumps

Posts.Content: Hi Denx It is natural for you to think that every ache and pain you have is the cancer returning. I have very sharp pains in my ribs on the side of my surgery. I convinced myself  that the cancer had spread to my bones. I went to my GP who referred me back to the breast cancer consultant who arranged for a bone scan to put my mind at rest. It came back clear and it appears my rib pain is due to the radiotherapy. Have a word with your GP again and ask if you can have a bone/ CT scan. I do have pains in my right side too at times. Seems it is coming out in sympathy with my left side. Looking at previous posts this is common. Good luck. No good telling you to ignore these pains as you need confirmation that everything is ok. Take care Sue x x
Posts.Title: Young and worried

Posts.Content: I am waiting for a mamagram to as I had surgery , chemo and radio which finished in November 08, I am sure they check both sides. Have a lot of pain in my left "breast area" , the top of my arm and in my left rib. Told consultant that I was worried that cancer was in my bones. He arranged a bone scan for me within 2 weeks and had all clear today which was a relief. Please ask and ask for a scan if you are worried. My consultant says the pain is from the effects of the radiotherapy so have resorted to painkillers. I think we are all paranoid and frightened. GOOD LUCK Sue xxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: check ups!

Posts.Content: Hi Pez I had 6 x TAC chemo and I managed to splash a little bit of weed killer on my hand. It looked like second degree burns on my hand and took ages to clear up. I wondered if your friend is hand washing and the detergent has caused this reaction. Tell her to wear rubber gloves and gardening gloves of course. We live and learn. Sorry just a thought. Someone else may have more experience of this. Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel rash on hands

Posts.Content: Pointer  Hi. When I had my results it was with the B C Consultant.  A nurse was there too. My mammogram and ultrasound were both clear but the biopsy showed lobular breast cancer. I was ok until he told me i needed a mastectomy. I went in alone but my son and partner were in the waiting room so they called them in. The look on my son's face made me cry. Have you got someone to go with you? I would recommend that you do. Lets hope for good news. Sue  Diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Results day looming

Posts.Content: Hi Di Sorry just seen your post. I can't remember having an itchy rash. Where is it? Does it respond to E45 cream? Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Itchy rashes

Posts.Content: Hi  I had all my chemo sessions via a cannula without any problems. Nurses love my veins. So easy to find. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Cannula vs PICC vs Port??

Posts.Content: Hi GrandmaStar II haven't been on Tamoxifen but have been on Anastrozole for over 9 years now out of the 10. Try and get Arimidex as I have found this is the best. My doc tried to put me on a different generic brand but the side effects were horrible. Told him I was worth the extra expense and luckily I have been prescribed Arimidex ever since. All the best. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Swapping from Tamoxifen to Anastrozole

Posts.Content: Hi Redd   So sorry you are feeling so down. I remember thinking after my last chemo 9 years ago that I would not want to do that ever again. This was before the births of my 4 grandchildren whom I thought I would never see.  Would now do anything to spend more time with them . Is your oncologist hopeful that the new chemo would work?  I wish you all the best and of course at the end of the day it is your decision. Tomorrow is another day. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Not wanting anymore treatment

Posts.Content: EleanorNya  Hi there. I was diagnosed with lobular breast cancer in my left breast which had spread to my lymph nodes and therefore had a mastectomy and full clearance of nodes. I then had 6 sessions of chemo and 13 rounds of radiotherapy. I went on to have breast reconstruction 2 years after diagnosis. I am 10 years no evidence of disease on 22nd Feb. Don't write your Mum off yet. She will be well looked after and will be given the treatment to fight this disease. I had a CT and bone scan prior to surgery to make sure there was no spread. Hopefully your Mum's CT scan will come back clear. Never give up hope. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Lobular Breast Cancer - Concerned Daughter

Posts.Content: Hi Beth I was diagnosed with Grade 2 lobular breast cancer in 2008. I had a CT scan and bone scan prior to mastectomy. The cancer showed that my lymph nodes had cancer cells so I had clearance of axilla too,  I had TAC chemo and radiotherapy and am still taking Arimidex for 10 years. I had a reconstruction in 2010 as plastic surgeon wanted the radiotherapy burns to clear. Hopefully your lymph nodes will be clear and you may not need chemo. Fingers crossed. I wish you all the best.  Take one step at a time.   Love Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed-Invasive Lobular

Posts.Content: Hi Louise All the best for tomorrow.  Sue xx
Posts.Title: Under wear when having surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Patterbelle I am so sorry your daughter has been diagnosed with BC at such a young age. When I was having my chemo treatment there was a young girl undergoing treatment who was the same age as my son at the time 24. She had her eggs frozen and is still alive and well despite an early reoccurance in the chest wall after 4 years. This was nearly 10 years ago.  All the best for the results on Friday. I cannot imagine what you are going through at the moment.  I am sending you much love and pray you get some good news. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: So scared

Posts.Content: Hi Gillian As you have not had radiotherapy you should be able to soak up the sun as usual with a high factor cream of course. Don't want you to get skin cancer so I would use a high factor sunscreen at all times. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: sunbathing

Posts.Content: Purplepants Hi All the best for Wednesday. Hope you get good news but if not there are plenty of ladies on here who will support you every step of the way. I was diagnosed in 2008 and had surgery chemo and rads followed by a delayed reconstrution in 2010. I am still very much here, Lots of love and hugs Sue xx
Posts.Title: Waiting......

Posts.Content: Hi again Yes the waiting for results is the worst thing. Have fingers and toes crossed for your Mum. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Lobular Breast Cancer - Concerned Daughter

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Your hair will start to grow again after your last chemo. Mine came back wavy but over time it has gone back to its normal dead straight. Good luck with your treatment.  Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: jaggy stubble

Posts.Content: Hi Laura Got mine at Nicola Jane in their sale for £19.99. Just plain black but very nice. Love Sue x x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy/Reconstruction swimwear

Posts.Content: Hi I watched it too and you looked lovely. Congratulations  xxxx Sue
Posts.Title: Thinking positive Going on this morning show

Posts.Content: Bonnie1978 Hello there. Did you have radiotherapy? This can cause bone pain for years after treatment. I am 11 years post diagnosis and had pain under my arm and in my back I rang the Breast Unit and the BCN told me to go to the GP and get a 2 week referral. I did this and saw the Consultant who arranged a bone scan  Luckily all was fine. The Breast unit will always talk to you even if you have been discharged from the clinic. All the very best. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Secondary Scare

Posts.Content: I have rib pain but this is due to the effects of radiotherapy. Am sure you are ok as you have had a clear bone scan. Thats the trouble with cancer. Every pain you have you think it has spread. Have a word with your surgeon or breast cancer nurse when you have your next appointment or give them a ring if you are still concerned. Love Sue x x
Posts.Title: rib pain

Posts.Content: We all feel the same. Tis natural. I had so much pain in my rib 3 months after my radiotherapy I was convinced the cancer was in my bones. Went to see GP and he referred me to surgeon who arranged a bone scan to put my mind at rest. It came back clear and it was such a relief. Let me know what they say tomorrow. Love Sue x x
Posts.Title: rib pain

Posts.Content: Hi Zena I had 6 x TAC chemo followed by 13 sessions or RT. My plastic surgeon would not do the reconstruction until 12 months from when RT finished. I had a full body CT and a bone scan prior to my recon. The tests were clear and I had my recon on 31st March 2010. My treatment finished in Nov 08. Ask how long you will have to wait after RT before you can have your recon. I had mine done at City Hospital in Birmingham. It may be that your docs may do it earlier than mine. I have to say I was so glad I had it done. I had an LD recon with implant. The result is wonderful and I feel like me again. Best of luck Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Why am I scared now as I am coming to end of my Chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Zena You will get there. Just take one step at a time. S xxxx
Posts.Title: Why am I scared now as I am coming to end of my Chemo?

Posts.Content: Brilliant news Karen. All the best. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Mammogram recall

Posts.Content: Hi Leonaw I would love to say the delay is good news but I honestly don't know. I am waiting for an op to remove my implant. Was told a few weeks and that was September. How do you get on with your GP  Mine used to look at the computer and tell me the results of scans. Just hang on in there. I honestly hope and pray it is good news for you.  Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Advice needed please!!

Posts.Content: Hi Peggysgirl You have come to the right place for support. We all know how you are feeling at the moment. The waiting is the worse part. I was diagnosed in 2008 with lobular breast cancer. Tests showed my lymph nodes had cancer cells so I had a mastectomy and clearance of the axilla. Had a CT scan and a bone scan prior to my surgery. Wondering if it had spread was so scary. I have used this forum many times as any worries and concerns I have I can share on here. Didn't feel I wanted to tell my nearest and dearest for fear of upsetting them.  Only those who have had a cancer diagnosis can know how it feels. All the very best for Friday.  I am still here after 9 years having been through surgery chemo and rads followed by a reconstruction. Sue xx
Posts.Title: I'm so scared

Posts.Content: Hello Eden or Welcome to the forum. There is always someone on line quite a few in the middle of the night. I see from your profile that you have had your chemo and are on the last lap with radiotherapy. I found rads a walk in the park after chemo but we are all different. My cancer diagnosis was in 2008 and I am still going strong. Have been on Arimidex for 9 years so another year to go. Keep posting Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Hi Sonia Just seen your post. My wig was Codi by Tendco too. Still have it 6 years later. So good I don't want to part with it. Good luck to all you ladies having chemo.  Sue xx
Posts.Title: Hair loss :-(

Posts.Content: Great news Crystal Kitty. It just shows that the results are available quite quickly. It is a shame that patients have to wait such a long time to find out. I had a mammogram last year and saw the breast consultant the week after. He told me it was clear. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Whoop whoop ... mammogram results

Posts.Content: I have been on Arimidex for nearly 12 months now. I have hot flushes sometimes and my fingers were very stiff when I woke up but soon came back to normal when I flexed them. At first if I sat down for a while I was very stiff when getting up. All the initial symptoms have reduced over time. The doc said that all the tablets have different side effects and it was better to stay on Arimidex if the side effects were bearable. Best of Luck Sue x
Posts.Title: Drug Arimidex

Posts.Content: Chezeds Wonderful news. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype result

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey I finished my treatment last November and had mastectomy, chemo and radiotherapy. I just want my life back as I am feeling exactly like you. I felt better during the treatment. I am older than you 59 but I was so active and feel like I have hit a brick wall too. Everyone says I look so well. If only I could feel as good as I look. Sorry I assume we have to be patient!!!!!! At least you are not alone feeling as you do. Are you on tablets. I am on Arimidex and have been told they make you tired. Where is your pain? I have arm shoulder and rib pain from radiotherapy. Have to take painkillers all the time at the mo. Love Sue x x
Posts.Title: life after cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Sortitout All the very best for tomorrow. Whatever the outcome you will cope. It is 10 years today since I was diagnosed and still very much here. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Results day tomorrow - both hopeful and terrifirf

Posts.Content: TheScriptFan Hello I had an LD reconstruction with implant and an implant in my right good side to match  Plastic surgeon asked if I wanted to be a bit bigger than my original 36a so I thought why not, Am now a 38c/d. I slept on my back from the start with the aid of a V shaped pillow. I also had a silk fitted sheet on the bed which allowed me to move easier. It was a weird feeling in my back like  being impailed with a wooden broom handle. Will be interested if you have the same sensation. I came out of hospital without any drains and had a District Nurse visit me to change dressings for a few weeks. This may have been a luxury no longer available as my op was in 2010. The only difference I found was that it was more difficult to swim. I kept tipping over!! All the best for Monday Love Sue
Posts.Title: Reconstruction using back muscle, anyone else??

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I have been a member of this site for several years and get these friend requests from time to time. Sick people I am sorry to say. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Friend request

Posts.Content: Hi Lin What a terrible time you have had. I was diagnosed in 2008 and still have an annual appointment with my Breast Consultant and an annual mammogram. I have except on one occasion seen the main man. Have not seen my oncologist since 12 months after my chemo finished. I am still on Arimidex for 10 years so hopefully I will be discharged from the clinic next year. I had a very supportive GP. As she/he is responsible for your care perhaps you can discuss your concerns with him Pals may also help you. All the best. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Disappointing consultation

Posts.Content: The worry never goes away to be honest.  My oncologist told me that if it comes back it is usually quick. Not sure if that is encouraging or not.. I am a glutton for punishment tho as I am a volunteer at our local hospice. I do believe that they will find a cure for cancer. Just wish they would hurry up.       Love Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer remission and 5 year plus survivors

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed on 22nd Feb 2008. Of the 10 nodes tested 8 had cancer cells. Had mastectomy and full node clearance. After being mutilated, poisoned and burnt to a crisp I am still very much here. And kept my sense of humour. Had reconstruction in 2010 and look as good as new. It is true that after you have finished treatment you do not use the site as much. Have made so many friends on this site with a few of us meeting up a couple of years ago. Am still taking Arimidex and will be for another 4 years but if it stops the cancer returning bring it on.  Good luck girls.  Sue xxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer remission and 5 year plus survivors

Posts.Content: Hi Dee So pleased that you have your wigs. They give you so much confidence I know. Mine was a highlighted bob and very much like my own hair that people did not realise I had a wig on. One lady said I was so lucky not to have lost my hair during chemo.lol Have my own hair again now but am keeping my wig for bad hair days. Best of luck with the rest of your treatment. Love Sue x x
Posts.Title: hair lost

Posts.Content: Hi Sophie Looks wonderful. I have still got my wig even though it is over 9 years since I wore it. Think I may be tempting fate if I get rid of it now. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: See profile pic for wig no. 4!

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea Am back from City Hospital Birmingham with two boobs again. Great feeling. Am a bit battered and bruised and I have to take painkillers every 4 hours but am feeling better every day. How are you doing? Sue xxxxxx
Posts.Title: bc with alot underarm lymph node involvement

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea Just thought I would let you know that I had a mastectomy and full ax clearance of lymph nodes as 19 out of 20 had cancerous cells. After chemo and RT i finished treatment in Nov 08 and have been taking Arimidex. I had a full body scan last month and have had the all clear to have a reconstruction on 31st March. So pleased your bone scan was clear. I hope you can get your chemo started soon. Just thought you would enjoy a positive story. Love Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: bc with alot underarm lymph node involvement

Posts.Content: Hi Sue Sorry for the delay in replying. I was diagnosed with invasive lobular cancer in Feb 2008 and had mastectomy and axillary clearance too as 9 out of 10 of my lymph nodes had cancerous cells. I had 6 x TAC chemo sessions and 5 weeks of radiotherapy ( 13 sessions)  and I am now on Arimidex for 5 years. I had a reconstruction 5 weeks ago and am feeling good. The time will go quickly for you and you can look forward to a lovely Christmas. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: bc with alot underarm lymph node involvement

Posts.Content: Hi Chris 77 I have been on Arimidex for over 9 years and found the side effects manageable. My GP tried to fob me off with another brand he said was the generic copy. Did try it for 3 months and it did not suit me. Had dreadful headaches. Persuaded to put me back on Arimidex which I continue to use. Hopefully only 12 months to go. Will be interesting to see how I feel when I stop.
Posts.Title: RE: anastrozole

Posts.Content: Hi Judith Have been on sleeping tabs since I was diagnosed so I do manage to sleep ok.  Not sure if the searching for words is due to the chemo, Arimidex or old age. I am 68 now and retired of course. I do have 4 grandchildren aged 5 and under and I try and keep up with them.  I did have a couple of weeks without the tabs and found my mobility was so much easier. Saw BC Consultant last week and he said to stay on them. To much of a coward to stop.  Roll on next year.  Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: RE: anastrozole

Posts.Content: Hi Debbie Glad op went well. I found the underarm pain was worse than the breast removal. Had a bit of fluid build up after a few weeks and had to have it syringed off but could not feel it as was still numb. Best of luck with your results next Monday. Love Sue x x
Posts.Title: WHY AXILLARY CLEARNCE ????

Posts.Content: Hi Debbie. I had SNB prior to my mastectomy which showed cancerous cells therefore I had full axillary clearance. Contact your breast cancer nurse and ask why this procedure is thought necessary for you. You have a right to know. Best of luck with the mastectomy on 8th. Sue x x
Posts.Title: WHY AXILLARY CLEARNCE ????

Posts.Content: Hi Mille  I have been on these tablets for over 8 years. I remember when I first took them I was so stiff and felt like an old woman. This side effect did wear off after a while so don't despair.  Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: anastrozole- help with lead joints

Posts.Content: Galluss  Hi. How frustrating for you. You seem to be doing all the right things. Are you losing any weight at all on SW. Just a thought. Have you had your thyroid checked? I am 10 years post diagnosis and treatment and SW worked for me. I have an underactive thyroid. Your GP and Oncologist are not being at all helpful. Perhaps some anti depressant may help short time. I have finished Arimidex after 10 years. Thought I would feel different now but I don't. All the best Sue xxx.
Posts.Title: Weight Issues

Posts.Content: Hi Lxg27 As London Lass has said. That is not good enough. Please pester your GP and tell her how stressed you are. In the meantime give Macmillan a ring and have a chat to them. Fingers crossed that it is nothing sinister but you need to know. Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: How long did you wait for screening appointment? *incredibly stressed...

Posts.Content: Hi LXG27 Wishing you all the very best for your appointment tomorrow  Sue xx
Posts.Title: How long did you wait for screening appointment? *incredibly stressed...

Posts.Content: Hi Deb09 I was diagnosed with lobular cancer with lymoh node involvement. Had a mastectomy and axilla clearance followed by chemo and radiotherapy. Went on 2 years later to have a breast reconstruction. Next February I will be 10 years cancer free You are understandably worried and frightened but you have every chance of beating this disease.  Waiting for scan results is the worse part. I had a CT and a bone scan before my surgery so having scans is "normal" at this stage. There are lots of survivors on this site so take heart. Lots of love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Devastated and petrified diagnosed with 2cm lobular breast cancer...

Posts.Content: Fantastic news Zizza  Am so pleased for you. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result - just need to vent

Posts.Content: Hi Zizza All the best for Tuesday  Am nearly 10 years post diagnosis. Hopefully all will be well for you but if not you have a big family here to support you. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result - just need to vent

Posts.Content: Hi Ange Just logged on tonight. All the best for your op tomorrow. Sleep well. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Big op tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Jdperry  Hi. I see you are a young woman and I can understand how you feel. Have you got to decide next week? I had a delayed reconstruction after rads so I was without a breast for over a year. Couldn't wait to have my reconstruction but it's a very personal thing. Am sure you can delay this procedure and have a long hard think about how you feel about another op. All the very best . Sue Diag 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Breast reconstruction yes or no?

Posts.Content: Hi Tiger I had chemo drugs administered by cannula in my hand. I have always had good veins so it was not a problem for me.  The oncology unit will discuss the different options for you before treatment starts. All the best Sue x
Posts.Title: New chemo starter

Posts.Content: Hi Anne So pleased you got your result and can now relax. Hope you get yours soon too Pearl. Have had 9 annual mammograms since diagnosis. I am less anxious now.  Am always checking my breasts tho as a mammogram didn't detect my lobular cancer. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: Hi Zizza All the best for Tuesday  Am nearly 10 years post diagnosis. Hopefully all will be well for you but if not you have a big family here to support you. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result - just need to vent

Posts.Content: Fantastic news Zizza  Am so pleased for you. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result - just need to vent

Posts.Content: Hi Lassie 101 I suffered from dry eyes and still do sometimes. My onologist recommended Viscotears. They do a liquid or gel . I find the gel best. I have mine on prescripton but you can buy it over the counter. Sue.
Posts.Title: awful dry sore eyes

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies As you say no news is good news. Has your GPs practice any secretaries? I usually plague mine to give me the results or arrange for a telephone call from the doc if they are to unable to give them to me. Next ring your BCN. The stress of waiting for results is not funny.
Posts.Title: Still waiting for mammogram results

Posts.Content: Congratulations Jo I found this time a bit weird and scary. No more regular appointments and a feeling of what happens now. I am 9 1/2 years into taking Arimidex after my treatment so only 6 months to go. Can't wait to stop taking the tablets and feeling free at last.  Lots of love  Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Last Herceptin done! thank you

Posts.Content: Hi Leigh8365 Sorry you haven't had any replies as yet but welcome to the forum. I had an LD reconstruction with implant in 2010 but it was carried out 12 months after radiotherapy had finished. I hope you get advice from your BCN tomorrow  I am sure massaging with bio oil will do the skin good. I used it on my scars. All the very best. Sue Diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: LD Flap Recon with Tissue Expander

Posts.Content: Hi Meg. I had breast cancer last year and had a mastectomy, chemo and RT. i finished treatment in Nov 08 and now facing a reconstruction in the New Year. Sorry to hear about the diagnosis and at such a young age too. I was in chemo with a girl of 27 who had a double mastectomy and reconstruction. She had just got maried too and had eggs harvested in the hope she can have a family after 5 years. Your daughter and her husband should go ahead with their plans as I know it is hard but life does go on. I was very jealous of my friends leading normal lives and going on holiday etc but when my treatment is finally over I will have to make up for lost time. Families are funny things. My sister who lives in the Lake District which is about 230 miles away has been so supportive and has come down and looked after me after my op and after my last chemo. My brother who lives 2 miles away has not even bought me a bunch of flowers. He rings very occassionally and asks how I am. Just says you know where we are if you need me. I am a positive person but if I heard anyone else say stay positive I would have screamed. It isn't easy when you are frightened. Hope the treatment goes well. Hope your son in law reguarly goes to see his sister. Your daughter could perhaps take her shopping or help by cooking a few meals for her. It is a lonely time and she will need all the support she can get. As you say there are no easy answers. Good Luck. Suexxxx
Posts.Title: Helping family to cope

Posts.Content: Hi Little bo bo Welcome to the forum. Your post made me smile. Little pert boo boo in future. I got my sports bras from Matalan. I was only a 38 C/D tho after my surgery. Sure someone will give you some ideas of where you can buy a bra. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Post surgery sports bras

Posts.Content: Hi Gray I finished treatment ie surgery, chemo and RT and have been on Arimidex for 18 months now. The side effects have diminished somewhat over time but as you say getting up after a night watching TV is a bit difficult. The oncologist told me that Arimidex is the best drug to be on so will have to grin and bear it. Nothing wrong with a good moan. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: I should be happy,but---------

Posts.Content: Hi Basonk Sorry you have had a bit of a shock re the possibility of having chemo. Do you know when the results from America will arrive.? Your oncologist will be making sure you have the treatment you need to beat this disease. If chemo is needed it is doable so try not to worry. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Thought I knew my treatment plan until today

Posts.Content: Hi Clarets 12 The first chemo is the worst as you don't know how it is going to affect you. I took a bowl with me the first night but was not sick at all throughout my chemo. Had a taste like cardboard in my moutn, had streaming eyes and a runny nose. The side of my lips were very sore too. The dreaded hair loss happened before my second chemo but went and got my wig prior to chemo starting so was prepared. I had TAC chemo. What are you having? I had 6 sessions every three weeks followed by 13 RT treatments over 5 weeks. Am now on Arimidex for 5 years. I finished my treatment last November. The time will go so fast and it will be but a blip in your life. Wishing you all the best. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: chemotherapy and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Scaredmum Don't worry you won't be having breast surgery on Monday.  When you attend the clinic you will have an examination from a breast cancer consultant. You will usually have a mammogram, an ultrasound and possibly a biopsy. My tests were on a Monday and I had to go back for the results on the Friday.  It all depends on your hospital when you get results. Some tell you the same day others somewhat longer. I wish you all the best for Monday.  Sue xxx Diagnosed and treated 2008
Posts.Title: Lump in my breast, confused about referral

Posts.Content: Hi Deb09 Just wanted to wish you all the best for Friday.  Sue  Diagnosed Feb 2008 and still here.
Posts.Title: Stressed/Anxious

Posts.Content: Hi Annie If you fancy microblading ask them to do a patch test. I facied tattoos but I had a reaction to the ink. Back to drawing them in and a full fringe. My eyebrows have never grown back properly even tho chemo was 9 years ago. My lashes did come back tho so all is not lost. All the best Sue xx
Posts.Title: Microblading eyebrows post-chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Callie 69 I had a delayed reconstruction after mastectomy chemo and rads. I opted for a LD reconstruction with implant to my left breast and another implant to my good right breast to match. Only one operation . Consider your lifestyle. Do you need to lift anything or play sports?  If so you may consider a tram flap and not LD recon. Your surgeon will discuss the options and it may depend on your body type and what your expectations are. My LD flap was very successful and looked good. After 7 years my implant has a capsular contracture and I am due to have the implant removed and replaced. Surgeon says I will be a day case. Knowing the NHS I will have to wait for this for months rather than weeks. Choose your plastic surgeon carefully.  I opted for one after recommendations from fellow breast cancer suffers.  My reconstruction was carried out in Birmingham. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Delayed reconstruction after bilateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Bagpuss 2 Sorry for the delay. Will message you of course. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Delayed reconstruction after bilateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Tessa. Have been on Arimidex for 17 months now. I was on HRT prior to dx so when I started the tablets I got and still have hot flushes. Not too bad tho just got hot. No sweating thank goodness. Other side effects for me are stiff fingers and stiffness in the legs when getting up esp early morning. As soon as I get going tho I am fine. Do not have zoladex.  The Arimidex has not caused me any problems. Hope it will be the same for you. Am just going to try yoga for the first time at 11. May be in traction later. lol Love Sue x x x
Posts.Title: chemotherapy and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Emaline Wishing you all the best for your appointment tomorrow. The waiting is the worse part. Fingers crossed all will be well. If not we are all here to support you. Love Sue  Diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Cold Feet (The TV programme not the things on the end of your legs...

Posts.Content: Bagpuss2 Sorry for the delay. Will message you of course. Love Sue xx Have sent u a friend request
Posts.Title: Delayed reconstruction after bilateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: Minty63 Hi Minty I am an old timer who was diagnosed with lobular grade 2 cancer back in 2008. I was expecting surgery and tablets but it was found my lymph nodes were cancerous so had a mastectomy 6 TAC chemo and radiotherapy.  I come on this forum from time to time to encourage newbies. Chemo isn't pleasant but you will get through it. Rads by comparison is a walk in the park ( in my case anyway)    I  have just finished 10 years of Arimidex so I am finally out the other side. Sundays are a bit quiet on here but I am sure you will get lots of replies soon.  All the very best Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis and terrified of chemotherapy and radiotherapy...

Posts.Content: Hi Brightspirit Best of luck with your LD reconstruction. i had my delayed LD recon in 2010 at City Hospital Birmingham although I live in Worcester. Hope you have a v shaped cushion ready as it really helps. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Delayed reconstruction after bilateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Fran Sorry you have had to join the site but welcome. I had all my TAC chemo sessions with a needle in my hand as I have good veins and did not have any problems. Perhaps you could have your first chemo that way and see how you get on. A lot of ladies have the portocath and will be able to tell you what it is like. As regards the cold cap i would go for it. It was not available at my hospital so I had no choice. I lost my hair just before my second chemo. Went to get my wig before chemo so I could match it with my own hair and style. I must say the wig I got was so good that friends thought it was my own hair. I had my own hair cut short just as the hair was startng to fall out but then had it shaved as the remaining hairs came out all over the place and I preferred to get rid of it. Strangly liberating. I am 2 years on from my first chemo and my hair is thicker than ever and back to what it was. Good luck for 28th. I know you are scared but the chemo will not be as bad as you fear. You will have lots of support from the ladies on the site who have gone through the treatment and can support you every step of the way. Love Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: Should I have a portocath?

Posts.Content: Hi Anne Sorry to hear of your surgery problems but hopefully all is sorted now. So pleased you may be let out tomorrow. Nothing like your own bed. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Post op LD flap causing problems

Posts.Content: Hi Jaydee I was diagnosed with lobular breast cancer in 2008 and this type of cancer was not identified by a mammogram. Have an annual mammogram on my remaining breast every year since and they have always come back clear. Have been having pains in my chest and back so am having a bone scan next week.  Had  3 before. I when I was first diagnosed, i before my reconstruction and i just over 12 months ago. I am sure we all feel anxious so you are not alone. If you are at all worried ask for a CT scan to put your mind at rest. All the best.  Sue xx
Posts.Title: Scanxiety

Posts.Content: Hi Kate Was wondering where you had gone after the merge. Sorry have not heard of Dermatomyosis. Good luck with the scans. Hope you get some relief soon. Sue x x
Posts.Title: Dermatomyosits

Posts.Content: Hi Catlover This is the worse time the not knowing. You say you can't fight this but you will find the strength believe me. I can't say don't worry because you will but it won't change things. How is your sister doing? She will be able to support you IF it is indeed cancer. Not long now to wait. Love Sue  diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Worried about breast lump I’m beside myself with worry

Posts.Content: Hi Bazzy I was diagnosed on 22nd February and had SNB on 15th March. Had a CT scan on 3rd April and a Bone Scan on 4th April. Finally had my mastectomy on 26th April  Had chemo and rads after and finished treatment on 14th November. Assume you are having chemo first. Try not to panic they will soon get you started.  My diagnosis was in 2008 and so far so good. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Hi again Bazzy The time between diagnosis and surgery was agonising as I had visions of the cancer growing out of control. Was assured by the BC nurse that it wouldn't grow that quick but easy to say when it's not your body. Have you had a treatment plan yet? The chemo was challenging but I was lucky that I was never sick or taken into hospital  I had 6 rounds of TAC chemo. The radiotherapy was in comparison a walk in the park. I went on to have reconstructive surgery in 2010 and am still taking Arimidex till next October.      Just take one step at a time. Come on here and talk to all the ladies on this site. We all know how you are feeling and have experience of whatever treatment plan you are given. You will cope don't worry. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Hi Jai I had an inverted nipple at times.  No lump but was worried so GP sent me to the Breast Clinic for 14 day referral Was diagnosed with lobular BC.  Go to the doc and get it looked at. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Male breast cancer query..

Posts.Content: Hi Have you got a date for your appointment? Make sure you take someone with you to support you and write down what he says. In the meantime write down what you want to know as it is easy to forget when you get there. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Worries.

Posts.Content: Guy Sterne from City Hospital did my delayed reconstruction in 2010. Had LD flap which was fine. I do not have any knowledge of fat transfer. All the very best. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon Birmingham / West Midlands area

Posts.Content: Hi Pipchick I smoked while I was going through treatment. My oncologist said it was not the time to give it up.  Have given up now mainly because of the cost. Just ignore her. Loads of health professionals smoke. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: 2nd armpit lump

Posts.Content: Tibu315  Hi Toni I had a Trendco wig too  A very stylish bob which was the same style as my original hair. I had a voucher from my Breast  Unit which covered the cost of the wig. They didn't have the cold cap at my hospital so I bought my wig before chemo started. All the best. I have still got my wig as one day I may wear it again. Hopefully not when having chemo again. Sue  Diagnosed 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: Wig shopping advice

Posts.Content: TeriShelly HI I have had a couple of bone scans and do have implants but it has never been mentioned. As Leo Lady says give them a ring in the morning. If you don't want to ring them get hold of your BCN. You need an answer before the weekend if possible as you will worry yourself to death. Fingers crossed all is well Sue xx
Posts.Title: Odd questions at bone scan

Posts.Content: Hi Sharmer So sorry that you have breast cancer. Good that your mastectomy has been arranged and you can get the evil tumour out of your body. Only advice I can give just take one step at a time. Treatment goes so quickly and you can then get on with the rest of your life. I had a delayed reconstruction as my plastic surgeon waits 12 months after rads have finished before he will do the op. I had LD flap plus implant. My diagnosis was 9 years ago and am still going strong. Still on Arimidex for another year.   All the best. Lots of us on this forum will hold your hand every step of the way. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: ... started my journey today

Posts.Content: So many Susan's on this site with BC. Must be our age. I was diagnosed with BC in 08 and had mastectomy with anx clearance followed by chemo and radiotherapy. Had TAC chemo which has the same side effects as FEC. Glad u r having a better day today. Chemo was not too bad for me. Had aching muscle in my neck and shoulder second day after treatment but only lasted 24 hours. Every chemo you have seems to follow the same pattern. Used to suck boiled sweets for cardboard taste in my mouth and had grapefruit segments every morning which seemed to help. Hope they find primary site soon. My BC was lobular. Not seen on mammogram or ultra sound but had biopsy as surgeon could feel a slight swelling under my arm. Best of luck with the treatment. Sue x x x
Posts.Title: ? Breast cancer primary not found

Posts.Content: Under each name you will see Personal Message. Click on it and send your message. It will go as an e-mail to your chosen friend and they can rely to you on a personal basis. Hope this helps. Sue x x x
Posts.Title: ? Breast cancer primary not found

Posts.Content: Supermum Hi I I am taking Nystan for thrush from my steroid inhaler. I take 4 doses a day. Drop into the mouth and keep it there for 1 to 2 minutes  then swallow. I take 1mg each time. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Nystan

Posts.Content: Blaster  I had LD reconstruction in 2010. I think it all depends on your life style if this is the reconstuction for you. Do you do any sports that use your back muscles or do you have to do any lifting? I found the procedure very sucessful and the results were very good. The plastic surgeon put an implant into my right breast too at the same time so they matched. The procedure was painful but I chose the LD as it had a quicker recovery time than Diep. Have they given you any choice? Let me know if there is anything specific you would like to know.. I was 59 when I had my op and have a high pain threshold . Sue  Diag 22/2/2008
Posts.Title: LD flap - back flap reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Mummykif I am a lot older than you but I found M & S bras staid and very boring. I wrote to them and complained that although the price of their post surgery bras was reasonable I wished they could be prettier and dare I say sexier. I told them that unfortunately younger women appear to be diagnosed more and more and needed cheering up. I did get a reply and a thank you and they said they would pass my comments on to the buyers. I was given a couple of catalogues from my BC nurse. One was Nicola Jane I think. Best of luck. If I won the lottery I would set up my own company to provide beautiful garments for ladies with mastectomies because we are worth it. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: bras help

Posts.Content: Hi Moorsleep I had an LD reconstruction with implant althogh the Diep is considered the Rolls Royce of reconstruction. Had lots of friends who had the same op as you are having and they were all delighted with the results. Is it worth going through? Yes definately.. No pain no gain. My op was in 2010.All the very best. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and immediate reconstruction by diep at St Thomas' hospital...

Posts.Content: Hi again Jan The only relief I have is when I first get up it is fine but gets steadily worse during the day. I have just had 2 strong painkillers as the pain is really bad at this time of night. My friends and family want to know what is causing the pain. I wish I knew the answer. My doctor at one time suggested I should increase my dose of anti depressants. I am sure she thought I was exaggerating. If only that was true. I feel my breast are trying to escape from my body it's so tight. Hopefully someone will come up with the answer. I live in hope.  I have 4 grandchildren aged 5 and under and want to play with them without being in pain. At least we can have a moan together. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Hi Anne All the best for tomorrow. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Hi J4N My experience has not been as bad as yours but I can sympathise. I had LD reconstruction with implant in 2010 and all was well until around 15 months ago. I now feel I am wearing a steel bra and I am in pain 24/7. I thought perhaps my implant had ruptured but a recent MRI scan the BC Consultant has said my MRI results showed nothing that should concern us whatever that means. I am on painkillers which can't be doing me much good. Not sure what to do next but to be honest it has ruined my life as it is so so painful. Someone on the BCC site had the same and was going to have physiotherapy to try and ease the pain. Am due to see the doc on 9th August so I will see what she thinks. I hope she may refer me back to the plastic surgeon who did my reconstruction. We shall see. Just wanted you to know you are not alone.  Sue xxxxx
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Just another thought Anne. Is the second op to create a nipple perhaps?  I had that done a few months after reconstruction. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Sounds young to me Anne. Hope you have got your V shaped pillow ready. I had a silky fitted bottom sheet on my bed so it was easier to move around. Let me know how you get on. Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Hi Anne I had a delayed reconstruction because I had radiotherapy after my chemo and the plastic surgeon wouldn't do the recon until I was fully healed. My recon was in 2010 and until recently it was fine. I do think picking up my grandchildren has not helped me. But what can you do.  Perhaps you should mention that you are a childminder. I also had axillary clearance so that has weakened my arms.   Hopefully your surgery will go well. Just try not to lift with that arm.  Surgery techniques have changed somewhat no doubt. Sorry if we have worried you. We might just have been unlucky.  Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Hi Anne As I said before things have moved on since my surgery in 2010. The tissue expander is relatively new I think. I am sure everything will be fine. I had an implant in my good breast at the same time. The results I must say are wonderful.  I didn't fancy the DIEP for the same reasons as you. Longer recovery. You are no doubt a lot younger than me. I am 68 on 12th of this month.  Have a word with your surgeon if you are worried.  I wish you all the very best for your op. Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: complications following LD back muscle op

Posts.Content: Hi Di Good on you. Have sent u a pm today. Not long till Thursday. Have you got someone going with you? Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: weird areola

Posts.Content: Hi Diane All the very best for Thursday. My symptoms were an inverted nipple and puckering round the nipple area. Was diagnosed with lobular breast cancer in 2008. Surgery chemo and rads and still on Arminidex  Still here and enjoying my 4 grandchildren I thought i would never see. If it is cancer get ready to kick its arse.  Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: weird areola

Posts.Content: Hi JustLittleMe I have a mammogram on my good breast which also has an implant but not on the reconstructed breast. I did however find some lumps in my reconstructed boob. Rang BCN and saw a nurse at the clinic within a week who thought the lumps were in the implant. An ultrasound done the next week confirmed this was the case. Since then I have had an MRI breast scan and although the breast implant has not ruptured I am having the implant removed and replaced. Implants do not last forever so its best to check them too.  Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Mama gram after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Welcome to The Breast Cancer group. Sorry you are feeling so sad and alone. You have got all of us to talk to now. I am in remission at the moment as I was diagnosed in 2008. I still come on here occasionally to give my support especially to new folks. No doubt you will have lots of posts today as it is hardly a day to go out and about. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: alone

Posts.Content: Hi Diane All the very best for Thursday. My symptoms were an inverted nipple and puckering round the nipple area. Was diagnosed with lobular breast cancer in 2008. Surgery chemo and rads and still on Arminidex  Still here and enjoying my 4 grandchildren I thought i would never see. If it is cancer get ready to kick its arse.  Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: weird areola

Posts.Content: Hi Di Good on you. Have sent u a pm today. Not long till Thursday. Have you got someone going with you? Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: weird areola

Posts.Content: Hi Ludo I was diagnosed with lobular cancer which had spread to my lymph nodes in 2008. Had mastectomy plus chemo and radiotherapy. Over the last 10 years I have had breast and back pains and I have always been sent for a bone scan.  As secondaries are often found in the bones I think the first scan to be offered is a bone scan.  I have no idea if a bone scan is more available than an MRI. Perhaps you could ask your BCN. I had a bone scan prior to surgery and another before reconstruction. I have had another two in the last 7 years. All came back clear which was a relief. If a bone scan is offered I would take it and put your mind to rest.  Radiotherapy can have long lasting effects. The oncologists don't really tell you about the effects of the treatment. All the very best Sue xx
Posts.Title: Dragging pain in breast/chest 3 months after radiotherapy ??

Posts.Content: Hi Tally. Am not too far away from you in Worcester. Had lobular BC in left breast and cancer cells found in sentinel node biopsy. I had a bone scan and CT scan prior to my mastectomy and auxillary node clearance. If the lymph nodes they took are clear you may not need the bone scan or CT scan as these are done to see if the cancer has spread as a rule. Mine were both clear thank goodness and after chemo and RT am now waiting for an appt for reconstructive surgery in The City Hospital in Birmigham. Best of luck with the RT Sue xxxxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Newbie here

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear about your Mum's diagnosis but welcome to the site. I was diagnosed with BC in Feb 08 and had a mastectomy and full clearance of lymph nodes as 7 out of 8 had cancer cells. I had both a bone scan and CT scan before the mastectomy and luckily they were both clear. I then had 6 courses of chemo followed by 13 courses of radiotherapy which finished in November. The radiotherapy was every other day for 5 weeks and during the treatment my skin was ok just a bit sore and they give you cream to put on which helps. After the treatment finished the skin got very red like bad sunburn which was painful but it eventually cleared up. I am on Arimidex for 5 years too. I had stiffness in my legs and fingers when I first took it but am not too bad now. Everyone is different of course so you will have to be guided by the oncologist.. If you want any more info let me now. Wishing you all the best. Sue x x x
Posts.Title: advice for my mum, please

Posts.Content: Hi Noj. I replied to you last night but it seems to have disappeared!!!!!!!!! I had 13 sessions over 5 weeks. I have a medium complextion and found that by using the aqueous cream they give you I was not too bad. The soreness builds up as you would expect and continues for a few weeks after the last treatment. I was lucky that the skin did not break as this is quite common. Its rather like very bad sunburn. You will need to cover up in the sun as you will burn easily. Best of Luck Sue x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy.... advice please

Posts.Content: Debs64 Ha ha. A bit like going to the dentist for a tooth ache which disappears when you get an appointment. I would take any scans which are offered.  I still get headaches but after 10 years of taking the tablets I can't blame them on those any more. All the best. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: Debs64 Hi there, I was on Amimidex and did at one time suffer very bad headaches, My GP sent me for a brain scan as a precaution too. Better to find out and hopefully put your mind at rest.. Mine came back clear. Hope yours does too,   Love Sue  Diagnosed 22/2/2008.
Posts.Title: Headaches with letrazole. GP sending me for a brain scan

Posts.Content: I had Grade 2 lobular cancer confirmed after core biopsy but I had cancer cells in my lymph nodes which was confirmed by SNB prior to mastectomy. Have had chemo and radiotherapy and am now on Arimidex. Tumour size not known prior to op but was 1". Good luck with appointment. Sue x x
Posts.Title: Confused

Posts.Content: Sosad2019 Hi there I had the same diagnosis as your Mum. I had a mastectomy and clearance of lymph nodes. 9 out of the 11 tested had cancer cells Before my surgery I had a CT and bone scan which is standard practice so don't get too worried about that. I had 6 rounds of chemo and 19 rounds of radiotherapy and had a breast reconstruction after the radiotherapy site had settled down. Next week on the 22nd it will be 11 years since my diagnosis. I was 57 when diagnosed. The treatment wasn't pleasant but doable  I called that time gruelling.  As you say your Mum has been fit until now I am sure she will cope. The NHS are very good in my opinion when dealing with cancer. I have no complaints about my treatment and support. Hopefully the scans will come back clear and she will then get her treatment plan. Would your Mum join the Community perhaps. She would get so much support. Lots of love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: My Mum - needs help

Posts.Content: You will see a Doctor before the chemo starts so dont worry about the rash. When I started my chemo I read all the possible side effect possible and frightened myself to death. The first night I took a bowl up to bed in case I felt sick. Was surprised to find in the morning that I felt fine. Everyone is different of couse but most of the ladies having chemo with me agreed that it was not as bad as they expected. Had a list on the wall and every time I had a treatment I crossed it off the list. Good luck tomorrrow. Sue x x
Posts.Title: First Chemo very nervous

Posts.Content: Hi Laura It is early days yet. I had a delayed reconstruction using my back muscle and was out of it for a couple of days. The morphine played tricks on my mind. I was convinced I was on a mixed ward and all the men had hairy chests.  I had my op on a Thursday and was out on the Sunday.  The anesthetic may have knocked her about too. I didn't really want any visitors except my partner and son as I felt rubbish. She will bounce back I am sure.  Wishing you all the best. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Mom diagnosed with invasive lobular breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi again Heidi Give the McMillan helpline a ring. They may be able to help you. Go with the implants if that is what you want. A friend of mine from chemo 27 had double mastectomy with implants and she is very happy with them. You just want to look normal again so stick to your guns. Have you anyone you can take with you to the hospital to give you moral support? Love Sue x x
Posts.Title: HELP...looking for advice information anything on breast reconstr...

Posts.Content: Hi Madcat I was diagnosed with invasive lobular cancer in my left breast and in the lymph nodes in Feb 08. Lobular cancer can be found in both breasts at the same time so my right breast was also checked but was found to be ok. I had a bone scan and CT scan prior to my mastectomy and node clearance. Had 6 sessions of TAC chemo followed by 13 sessions of RT. I finished my treatment in November 08 and am now waiting for reconstructive surgery in early 2010. You must still be in shock only having only just been told. Glad that your surgery will take place soon as waiting is the worst part. You are not on your own now that you have joined this forum. You will get through this. Just take one step at the time. Lots of love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: ILC, talk about a bombshell!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Heidi Welcome to the site. Sorry you are having problems with your surgeon. I had a mastectomy with lymph node clearance followed by chemo and RT. I will be having a reconstruction early next year using the muscle and skin from my back. I could have had a recon using the muscle and fat from my tummy but the operation is much longer and recouperation time is longer too. Was told that as I had RT the implant option is not avalable for me as the skin would not stretch over the implant. If all options are available to you stick to your guns and opt for implants only. You can be referred by your GP to any hospital you like and to which surgeon you want to do your reconstruction. Where do you live? I live in Worcester but I am having my surgery in Birmingham because I have seen reconstructions that the plastic surgeon has done and they look wonderful. Best of luck. Am sure you will get more answers from others on this site who have had different reconstructions. Love Sue x x x
Posts.Title: HELP...looking for advice information anything on breast reconstr...

Posts.Content: Hi Shey I had my chemo over 9 years ago now. I met some lovely ladies going through treatment at the same time. One of them came to visit me about 3 months after we had finished the chemo. We were chatting away and then she said what was I talking about. I said I have no idea. We then laughed hysterically. She was much younger than me too. Am still searching for the right word sometimes but that may be my age rather than the chemo. Everything else I now blame on Arimidex.  Love Sue xx
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain !

Posts.Content: I had invasive lobular cancer too which was also in my lymph nodes. Had a mastectomy, chemo and radiotherapy and am on Arimidex for 5 years. My treatment finished in November 08. Had the same feelings as you the thought that I would fall down if I didn't sit down. Still feel weary rather than tired as when I go to bed I wake up at least 3 times. Just a thought, have they tested your thyroid function? I have had an underactive thyroid for several years but as I had the same weird feelings as you I was tested again a couple of months ago and have now been on a higher dose. Feel a hell of a lot better than I did so perhaps you could ask your GP to do a blood test to check yours. Am due to have a recostruction at the end of this year using the muscle from my back. Good Luck and Take Care Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Paronoid or something lurking

Posts.Content: Hi AuntyJules I had my tattoos done 7 years ago and it has faded somewhat. I am now 68 so not so bothered about it. Ring your BCN as I can't see why they wouldn't do it. You can but ask. £750 seems very expensive to me.  I am still on the BC clinic books as still on Arimidex   Am having my implant removed and replaced soon so I will ask re the tattoo then. All the best. Sue xx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer surgery aeriola tattoo now 11 years on...

Posts.Content: Hi Cuckoo I think it is different depending on your hospital. I had an annual check with the Breast Consultant one year and my Oncologist the next.  Only saw the oncologist twice and have seen the Breast Consultant only since then.  Think the oncologist would only need to be seen if their was any further cancer diagnosed.  I am very happy that I haven't seen mine for 7 years. Good that you are having 6 month appointments at the BC unit. An annual mammogram I assume too. All the best Sue xx
Posts.Title: 2 yrs post-treatment, should I still be seeing Oncologist?

Posts.Content: Hello I had TAC chemo 6 sessions  My oncologist told me I would lose my hair just before second chemo. I was putting my hands through my hair and it came off in handfuls. I got my partner then to shave it off.  Didn't like finding it on the pillow and in the plugholes. I didn't lose my eyebrows and eyelashes till chemo 5. Loss of hair up my nose was a pain. Everyone thought I had a cold as I was always sniffing.     All the very best. Your hair will come back in my case grey and curly. Sue xx
Posts.Title: TAC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Rosemarie Good luck tomorrow with your first chemo. I remember mine. I had the list of likely side effects handy plus my thermometer. Would recommend you invest in a good one as the one I was given by the oncology dept did not work.  Had chemo and felt fine. Had a takeaway curry that evening and went to bed with bowl in case I was sick. Woke the next morning and felt strangely normal. Obviously I did get some side effects over the course of the 6 TAC infusions but I was never sick and put on weight too. The cold cap was not available at my local hospital so I did lose my hair before the second chemo. Had a lovely wig though which I still have. The first chemo is the worse as you don't know what to expect. Not sure which chemo you are having but no doubt your oncologist has been through the likely side effects with you. My BC diagnosis was 9 years ago and I am still going strong. Love Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Nervous of my first chemo treatment!

Posts.Content: CWS Hi there. I had an appointment with the breast clinic on a Monday and had mammogram, ultrasound and biopsy. The results came back on the Friday. Not long to wait now for you and I wish you all the very best. I was diagnosed in 2008 and still going strong. Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Breast Clinic Appointment Tomorrow Afternoon

Posts.Content: CWS Fantastic news. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Breast Clinic Appointment Tomorrow Afternoon

Posts.Content: Hi Athena Welcome to the forum. I was diagnosed with Grade 2 breast cancer with lymph node spread. In fact 11 out of 12 nodes tested had cancer cells. I had a mastectomy and clearance of the axilla and it was my sister who travelled the length of the country to look after me after the op. 6 rounds of chemo and 13 rounds of radiotherapy followed  It is usual to have scans before surgery. I had CT scan and a bone scan.  Yes your sister will be in shock at the moment. At least she has you to help her through it. My diagnosis was 2008 so I have been clear for 10 years so don't despair. Lots of love and hugs Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Little sister diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: CWS Hi there. I had an appointment with the breast clinic on a Monday and had mammogram, ultrasound and biopsy. The results came back on the Friday. Not long to wait now for you and I wish you all the very best. I was diagnosed in 2008 and still going strong. Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Breast Clinic Appointment Tomorrow Afternoon

Posts.Content: taralou  Hi Edwina 10 years after treatment my eyebrows are still sparse. I use a pencil and have a longish fringe. Some ladies managed to wear false eyelashes but my eyes were very sore and were always running. The eyelashes hopefully will grow again quickly. All the best Sue  ( diag 22/2/2008) xx
Posts.Title: Eyebrows and eyelashes - What do you do when they are gone??

Posts.Content: CWS Fantastic news. Love Sue xxxx
Posts.Title: Breast Clinic Appointment Tomorrow Afternoon

Posts.Content: Hi Mitch I had an LD reconstruction and saline implant  in my mastectomy breast and a silicone implant in my right breast to match. This was done at the same time. My plastic surgeon was a perfectionist. I was very pleased that the breasts matched  All the best I hope you have a good plastic surgeon and you get the uplift and implant to your healthy breast you want. Sue xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery options when you already have implants
